page.title: 16MITCHELDEAN HEALTH SERVICES
page.content: Until recently a group of doctors ran a practice at Forest House, on the main crossroads at the southern end of Mitcheldean. The accommodation was cramped and car parking difficult. A purpose built health centre has now opened on a spare site in the town centre, close to shops and car parking facilities. As there is no chemist, prescriptions are dispensed at the centre. There is no dentist in the area, the nearest being Cinderford and Ross. There are no hospitals, the nearest small one being at Cinderford, with Gloucester having the nearest large one. Mitcheldean has a modern state run old peoples home known as Townsend House, together with a private one at Bradley Court, half a mile to the north. Drybrook has a doctors surgery and a private old persons home, the Euroclydon Hotel.
